lead_paragraph: The new accord denies — but does not permanently rule out — South Korea the right to enrich uranium or reprocess spent nuclear fuel, even for peaceful purposes.

headline.print_headline: World Briefing | Asia; South Korea: Nuclear Deal Revised
headline.main: U.S. and South Korea Reach Revised Nuclear Deal

snippet: The new accord denies — but does not permanently rule out — South Korea the right to enrich uranium or reprocess spent nuclear fuel, even for peaceful purposes.
abstract: United States and South Korea announce revisions to treaty that continues to deny south Korea's right to enrich uranium or reprocess spent nuclear fuel, but leaves open possibility South Korea could enrich uranium for civil nuclear energy in future.
